notations.RMSE(X,h): cost function measured on the set of examples using your hypothesis h
X: matrix containing all the feature values (excluding labels) of all instances in the dataset
There is one row per instance and the ith row is equal to the transpose of x(i), noted (x(i))T
notations.h: system's prediction function, also called a hypothesis
notations.m: number of instances in the dataset
notations.xi: vector of all the feature values (excluding the label) of the ith instance in the dataset
notations.yi: label (the desired output value for that instance)

notations.MAE(X,h): cost function measured on the set of examples using your hypothesis h
X: matrix containing all the feature values (excluding labels) of all instances in the dataset
There is one row per instance and the ith row is equal to the transpose of x(i), noted (x(i))T
notations.h: system's prediction function, also called a hypothesis
notations.m: number of instances in the dataset
notations.xi: vector of all the feature values (excluding the label) of the ith instance in the dataset
notations.yi: label (the desired output value for that instance)
